page.title: 06INTERESTING PEOPLE, SEAFORD
page.content: { MR. JOHN GASCOIGNE IS THE HEAD RANGER {OF THE SEVEN SISTERS COUNTRY PARK}AND HE IS DUE TO RETIRE THIS YEAR AFTER FOURTEEN YEARS IN THE JOB. HE WAS AWARDED{THE BRITISH EMPIRE MEDAL}IN THE QUEEN'S BIRTHDAY HONOURS LIST THIS YEAR AS A MARK OF HIS SUCCESS IN CREATING THE PARK AS IT IS TODAY. HE IS A{YORKSHIREMAN}WHOSE TRAINING WAS IN FARMING BUT WHOSE{LOVE OF FLOWERS, {ANIMALS, BIRDS AND THE COUNTRYSIDE IN {GENERAL}HAVE MADE HIM POPULAR WITH VISITORS TO THE PARK AND LOCAL GROUPS TO WHOM HE GIVES TALKS. HIS HOBBIES INCLUDE PAINTING, PHOTOGRAGHY, RECORDING BIRD'S SONG AND COMPILING EDUCATIONAL COMPUTER PROGRAMS ON WILDLIFE. {MR. PETER WHITE,}A NEWHAVEN TEACHER IS WELL KNOWN AS SEAFORD'S{TOWN CRIER. HE ANNOUNCES LOCAL EVENTS IN THE TOWN WITH A BELL, IN OLD FASHIONED STYLE.
